meanings.definition: To divert attention from someone towards oneself.
meanings.sent1: During the play, the actor upstaged his co-star by speaking loudly.
meanings.sent2: She always tries to upstage her classmates by wearing colorful outfits.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous puppy upstaged the birthday girl by stealing the spotlight.
meanings.sent4: Her infectious laughter upstaged the somber mood of the room.
meanings.sent5: The magician's disappearing act upstaged the clown's juggling routine.

meanings.definition: To outshine or overshadow someone else in a performance or event.
meanings.sent1: The talented singer upstaged the other contestants with her powerful voice.
meanings.sent2: The bright fireworks display upstaged the city skyline on New Year's Eve.
meanings.sent3: The clever joke upstaged the serious speech at the conference.
meanings.sent4: The colorful painting upstaged the plain one in the art gallery.
meanings.sent5: The grand finale of the concert upstaged all the previous performances.
